title: Kevin Warsh Federal Reserve Chair Nomination Sparks Intense Debate on Future Monetary Policy
body: BitcoinWorld Kevin Warsh Federal Reserve Chair Nomination Sparks Intense Debate on Future Monetary Policy WASHINGTON, D.C. ‚Äì In a move that could redefine U.S. monetary policy for years, President Donald Trump has nominated former Federal Reserve Governor Kevin Warsh to lead the central bank, immediately igniting discussions about interest rates, market liquidity, and the future of digital assets. This pivotal nomination, reported by Aggr News and announced via Truth Social, places a noted monetary hawk at the helm of the world‚Äôs most influential financial institution during a period of global economic uncertainty. Consequently, markets and policymakers are now scrutinizing Warsh‚Äôs extensive record for clues about the Fed‚Äôs next chapter. Kevin Warsh Federal Reserve Chair Nomination: Background and Immediate Reaction President Trump‚Äôs announcement positions Kevin Warsh for a return to the Federal Reserve, where he served as a Governor from 2006 to 2011. In his social media statement, Trump highlighted Warsh‚Äôs ‚Äúextensive research background in economics and finance,‚Äù predicting he would become ‚Äúone of the greatest Fed Chairs in history.‚Äù The financial community received the news with measured analysis, quickly parsing Warsh‚Äôs past speeches and policy writings. Furthermore, his reputation as a staunch advocate for central bank independence and fiscal discipline preceded the official nomination, setting the stage for a potentially significant shift in policy direction. Market analysts immediately began assessing the implications. Historically, Warsh has consistently argued for a rules-based, transparent approach to monetary policy, often expressing concern over prolonged periods of ultra-low interest rates. His academic and professional pedigree, including roles at the White House and Morgan Stanley, provides a foundation of traditional economic expertise. However, his views have also drawn clear lines, particularly regarding newer asset classes like cryptocurrency, which he has reportedly characterized as speculative instruments dependent on loose monetary conditions. Warsh‚Äôs Hawkish Monetary Policy Stance Explained A deep examination of Kevin Warsh‚Äôs public commentary reveals a coherent, long-held philosophy centered on monetary restraint. His hawkish disposition primarily advocates for higher real interest rates and reduced systemic liquidity. This approach aims to combat inflation proactively and maintain the dollar‚Äôs long-term value. For instance, during the post-2008 financial crisis era, Warsh often cautioned against the extended use of quantitative easing, warning of potential market distortions and asset bubbles. This philosophy contrasts with the more accommodative policies seen in recent years. The table below outlines the core differences between a hawkish stance, as typified by Warsh, and a more dovish approach: Policy Aspect Hawkish Stance (Warsh) Dovish Stance Primary Goal Price stability, inflation control Maximum employment, growth support Interest Rates Prefers higher rates to cool economy Prefers lower rates to stimulate economy Balance Sheet Advocates for reduction (quantitative tightening) Accepts expansion (quantitative easing) Risk Focus Asset bubbles, financial instability Economic slowdown, deflation Therefore, a Warsh-led Fed would likely prioritize tightening financial conditions faster than his predecessors, potentially through: Accelerated Rate Hikes: Moving federal funds rates higher to normalize policy. Aggressive Balance Sheet Runoff: Actively reducing the Fed‚Äôs holdings of Treasury and mortgage-backed securities. Forward Guidance Shift: Communicating a lower tolerance for inflation overshoots. Cryptocurrency Market Braces for Regulatory Scrutiny The nomination sends a particularly clear signal to the digital asset ecosystem. Kevin Warsh‚Äôs reported skepticism of cryptocurrencies as mere speculative vehicles poses a direct challenge to an industry accustomed to a low-rate environment. His argument suggests that digital assets flourished primarily due to abundant cheap capital and would struggle in a regime of higher real interest rates and tighter liquidity. This perspective immediately raises questions about the regulatory and philosophical stance the Fed might adopt under his leadership. Market data often shows an inverse correlation between crypto valuations and real yield expectations. For example, during past periods of Fed tightening rhetoric, major cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum have frequently experienced heightened volatility. Industry advocates counter that digital assets represent a fundamental technological innovation, not merely a speculative trade. They argue that the asset class is maturing and its value proposition extends beyond monetary policy cycles. Nonetheless, the potential for a less sympathetic ear at the highest level of U.S. monetary policy introduces a new layer of uncertainty for investors and developers alike. Expert Analysis on the Nomination‚Äôs Broader Impact Economic historians and policy experts are contextualizing this nomination within the Fed‚Äôs century-long evolution. ‚ÄúThe appointment of a chair with Warsh‚Äôs specific hawkish leanings often follows periods of significant monetary expansion,‚Äù notes Dr. Alisha Chen, a professor of monetary economics at Stanford University. ‚ÄúThe critical question is whether this shift aligns with the underlying economic data on employment, productivity, and wage growth, or if it represents a pre-emptive strike against perceived inflation risks.‚Äù Furthermore, the international dimension cannot be ignored. Other major central banks, including the European Central Bank and the Bank of Japan, may maintain more accommodative postures. A divergence where the U.S. Fed tightens policy more aggressively could lead to a stronger U.S. dollar, impacting global trade dynamics and emerging market debt. This global ripple effect underscores the profound responsibility of the Fed Chair. Past transitions, like the appointment of Paul Volcker in 1979 to combat stagflation, demonstrate how a single leader‚Äôs philosophy can reshape the global economic landscape for decades. Conclusion President Trump‚Äôs nomination of Kevin Warsh as Federal Reserve Chair marks a potential inflection point for American monetary policy. His well-documented hawkish philosophy, emphasizing higher interest rates and reduced liquidity, suggests a decisive move away from the accommodative policies of the recent past. While this could reinforce the Fed‚Äôs commitment to price stability and independence, it also introduces volatility for asset classes like cryptocurrencies that benefited from previous conditions. Ultimately, the Senate confirmation process and subsequent policy decisions will determine whether this nomination leads to a new era of monetary restraint and how the economy adapts to this significant change in leadership at the Federal Reserve. FAQs Q1: Who is Kevin Warsh and what is his background? Kevin Warsh is a former Federal Reserve Governor who served from 2006 to 2011. He has a background in economics and law, previously worked at Morgan Stanley, and served as a special assistant to President George W. Bush on economic policy. Q2: What does a ‚Äúhawkish‚Äù monetary policy mean? A hawkish monetary policy prioritizes controlling inflation, even at the risk of slowing economic growth. It typically involves advocating for higher interest rates and a reduction in the central bank‚Äôs balance sheet to tighten the money supply. Q3: How could Warsh‚Äôs nomination affect the stock market? Financial markets often react negatively to hawkish signals in the short term, as higher interest rates increase borrowing costs and can reduce corporate profits. However, long-term effects depend on whether the policy successfully ensures stability without causing a recession. Q4: Why is the cryptocurrency community concerned about this nomination? Warsh has expressed skepticism that cryptocurrencies have intrinsic value beyond speculation, suggesting their popularity is tied to low-interest-rate environments. His leadership could mean a less favorable regulatory and philosophical stance from the Fed towards digital assets. Q5: What is the next step in the process for Kevin Warsh to become Fed Chair? The nomination must be reviewed and confirmed by the U.S. Senate. This involves hearings before the Senate Banking Committee, followed by a vote in the full Senate, where he would need a simple majority to be confirmed. This post Kevin Warsh Federal Reserve Chair Nomination Sparks Intense Debate on Future Monetary Policy first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: Cronos price prediction 2026-2032: Will CRO reach $1?
body: Key takeaways The CRO price prediction for 2026 shows it will reach a maximum level of $0.15 and an average price of $0.1005. By 2029, CRO could reach a maximum value of $0.48, with an average trading price of $0.41. Cronos is expected to reach a maximum level of $0.98 in 2032. Cronos (CRO) is the native cryptocurrency token of the Cronos chain, a decentralized, open-source blockchain developed by the Crypto.com payment, trading, and financial services company. CRO aims to power the next generation of decentralized crypto assets and applications, serving as a utility token. And enable real-time, low-cost transactions globally. Cronos cross-bridge mainnet beta suggests a bright future for CRO. This feature aims to improve interoperability between significant blockchain ecosystems, potentially increasing CRO‚Äôs attractiveness to developers and users. title: El Salvador adds $50M in gold as it strengthens reserve strategy
body: The Central Reserve Bank (BCR) of El Salvador announced on January 303 that it made a new purchase of 9,298 troy ounces of gold, valued at $50 million, on international markets, reinforcing its push to build bullion reserves as gold prices soar. This was not the nation‚Äôs first distribution in a long time. The purchase comes after 13,999 troy ounces, which were similarly valued at about $50 million at the time, were acquired in September 2025. According to the central bank , the new purchase lifted the country‚Äôs total gold holdings to 67,403 ounces, valued at approximately $360 million at the current price. El Salvador expands gold reserves and Bitcoin holdings El Banco Central de Reserva realiz√≥ una nueva adquisici√≥n de 9,298 onzas troy de oro en los mercados internacionales, equivalentes a US$50 millones, como parte de su estrategia de incremento en las tenencias de este metal. pic.twitter.com/1GD7H4Bd0X ‚Äî Banco Central de Reserva (@bcr_sv) January 29, 2026 According to the Central Reserve Bank of El Salvador, ‚Äúthis second acquisition strengthens the country‚Äôs long-term assets while maintaining a prudent balance in the composition of the assets that make up the International Reserves,‚Äù the bank stated. However, no official target level for future purchases was specified in the statement. The BRC described gold as a ‚Äúuniversally strategic reserve asset‚Äù that supports long-term financial stability. It maintained that the metal increases trust among investors and citizens and protects the domestic economy from structural shifts in global markets. President Nayib Bukele reposted the announcement on X , ‚ÄúWe just bought the other dip.‚Äù It was unclear if Bukele was cheekily revealing the government‚Äôs own bitcoin purchase or celebrating the gold purchase. The recent gold purchase comes at a time when the nation is making ongoing efforts to increase its exposure to Bitcoin, further solidifying its reputation as a global leader in cryptocurrency. The government has gradually accumulated coins for the national treasury since making Bitcoin legal tender. On-chain data from Arkham Intelligence revealed that El Salvador has continued to accumulate bitcoin through a succession of one-bitcoin purchases, with recent transactions totaling between $84,700 and $95,400 each. The data reflects many additions over the past two weeks alone, including transactions of roughly $88,000‚Äì$89,000 on several consecutive days and higher-priced acquisitions above $95,000 earlier this month. The regular inflows are consistent with President Nayib Bukele‚Äôs vow for the government to buy one bitcoin each day, strengthening the country‚Äôs long-term accumulation strategy. On-chain data revealed that the country‚Äôs stack now stands at 7,547 Bitcoins, worth around $619.54 million at the current price of $82,087, down 6.53%. Global gold demand drives investors‚Äô purchases El Salvador‚Äôs recent action is taking place amid rising global demand for gold. The metal has rallied nearly 20% year to date, hitting multiple record highs amid intensifying geopolitical and macroeconomic tensions. Building on this momentum, investors globally have moved into safe-haven holdings. For instance, on January 20, the National Bank of Poland (NBP) announced plans to increase its gold reserves to 700 tons to lessen its dependence on conventional reserve currencies. Adam Glapinski, the President of NBP, revealed that the bank was the biggest net buyer among central banks in 2025, having bought over 100 tonnes of gold. While some central banks are transparent about their purchases, China is quietly increasing its gold holdings. According to a Kobeissi Letter report, China is still secretly hoarding gold. Last December, the country made its 14th consecutive monthly purchase of an extra 0.9 tons of the metal. The report noted China is reporting 10‚Äì11 times less gold than it actually purchases, meaning that the +27 tons of total gold purchases officially reported in 2025 may actually be +270 tons. A Cryptopolitan report dated January 27 noted that China‚Äôs projected gold purchases in November exceeded 10 tons, roughly 11 times the amount reported by the People‚Äôs Bank of China (PBoC). The report said that China is buying gold as if the world were in a huge crisis. Claim your free seat in an exclusive crypto trading community - limited to 1,000 members.

title: Hong Kong Stablecoin Licensing Unveils Groundbreaking Crypto Tax Framework for 2025
body: BitcoinWorld Hong Kong Stablecoin Licensing Unveils Groundbreaking Crypto Tax Framework for 2025 Hong Kong authorities have unveiled comprehensive plans to establish a stablecoin licensing regime and implement a groundbreaking cryptocurrency tax framework, positioning the financial hub as a global leader in digital asset regulation for 2025. The government will submit legislation to the Legislative Council this year to regulate digital asset custody while creating mechanisms for automatic international tax information exchange starting in 2028. This regulatory framework represents a significant evolution in Hong Kong‚Äôs approach to virtual assets, building upon previous initiatives while addressing emerging global standards. Hong Kong Stablecoin Licensing Framework Details The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) will implement a comprehensive licensing regime for stablecoin issuers operating within its jurisdiction. This regulatory approach follows extensive consultation with industry stakeholders and international regulatory bodies. The licensing framework will establish clear requirements for reserve management, redemption policies, and operational transparency. Issuers must maintain adequate reserves in high-quality liquid assets to back their stablecoins fully. Furthermore, they must implement robust risk management systems and undergo regular independent audits. Authorities designed the stablecoin licensing system to protect consumers while fostering innovation in the digital asset space. The framework specifically addresses algorithmic stablecoins, requiring additional safeguards for these more complex instruments. Regulators will categorize stablecoins based on their underlying mechanisms and risk profiles. This classification system will determine specific regulatory requirements for each type of stablecoin. The licensing process will include rigorous assessment of issuer governance, financial stability, and technological infrastructure. Digital Asset Custody Regulation Concurrently, Hong Kong will introduce legislation to regulate digital asset custody services through the Securities and Futures Commission (SFC). This legislation will establish licensing requirements for custodians holding virtual assets for clients. Custodians must implement stringent security measures, including cold storage solutions and multi-signature protocols. They must also maintain comprehensive insurance coverage and undergo regular security audits. The regulatory framework will mandate clear segregation of client assets from company funds. The custody legislation represents a crucial component of Hong Kong‚Äôs broader virtual asset regulatory ecosystem. It builds upon existing regulations for virtual asset trading platforms that the SFC implemented in recent years. This comprehensive approach creates multiple layers of investor protection across different segments of the digital asset industry. Regulators anticipate that these measures will enhance institutional participation in Hong Kong‚Äôs virtual asset markets. Crypto Tax Framework Implementation Timeline Hong Kong‚Äôs tax authorities will implement a new reporting framework for cryptocurrency transactions beginning in 2028. This framework will facilitate automatic exchange of tax information between jurisdictions under the Common Reporting Standard (CRS) for crypto assets. The Inland Revenue Department will amend existing laws to incorporate digital assets into Hong Kong‚Äôs tax reporting obligations. These amendments will define virtual assets for tax purposes and establish clear reporting requirements for financial institutions and virtual asset service providers. The government designed the implementation timeline to allow sufficient preparation time for regulated entities. Between 2025 and 2028, authorities will conduct extensive industry consultations and develop technical specifications for reporting systems. This phased approach enables market participants to adapt their systems and processes gradually. The timeline aligns with international developments, particularly the OECD‚Äôs Crypto-Asset Reporting Framework (CARF) that many jurisdictions plan to implement around the same period. International Tax Cooperation Mechanisms Hong Kong‚Äôs crypto tax framework will establish mechanisms for automatic information exchange with other jurisdictions. These mechanisms will operate through bilateral agreements and multilateral conventions. The framework specifically addresses challenges in tracking cross-border cryptocurrency transactions. It will require virtual asset service providers to collect and report detailed transaction information to tax authorities. This information will include wallet addresses, transaction amounts, and counterparty details where available. The tax framework represents a significant development in Hong Kong‚Äôs commitment to international tax transparency. It addresses concerns about potential misuse of digital assets for tax evasion while maintaining Hong Kong‚Äôs competitive tax environment. Authorities emphasize that the framework targets tax compliance rather than creating new tax liabilities. Existing tax principles will continue to apply to cryptocurrency transactions, with the new framework primarily enhancing reporting and transparency. Regulatory Context and Global Implications Hong Kong‚Äôs regulatory announcements occur within a rapidly evolving global landscape for digital asset regulation. Multiple jurisdictions have proposed or implemented stablecoin regulations in recent years. The European Union‚Äôs Markets in Crypto-Assets (MiCA) regulation establishes comprehensive rules for crypto assets, including stablecoins. Singapore‚Äôs Payment Services Act provides another regional model for digital payment token regulation. Hong Kong‚Äôs approach incorporates elements from these international frameworks while adapting them to its specific legal and financial context. The stablecoin licensing regime particularly addresses lessons from recent market events involving algorithmic stablecoins. Regulators have studied incidents where stablecoins lost their peg to underlying assets, causing significant market disruption. Hong Kong‚Äôs framework aims to prevent similar occurrences through robust reserve requirements and transparency obligations. The regulatory approach balances innovation with stability, seeking to foster responsible development of stablecoin technology. Impact on Hong Kong‚Äôs Financial Ecosystem These regulatory developments will significantly impact Hong Kong‚Äôs position as an international financial center. The clear regulatory framework may attract virtual asset businesses seeking jurisdictions with well-defined rules. Financial institutions previously hesitant to engage with digital assets may gain confidence to enter the space. The regulations could facilitate greater integration between traditional finance and digital asset ecosystems in Hong Kong. Market analysts anticipate that the regulatory clarity will stimulate innovation in financial technology. Hong Kong-based companies may develop new products and services leveraging regulated stablecoins. The custody regulations could encourage institutional investment in digital assets by addressing security concerns. Furthermore, the tax framework may reduce uncertainty for businesses and investors regarding their tax obligations related to cryptocurrency activities. Technical Implementation Considerations Implementing the stablecoin licensing and tax frameworks requires significant technical infrastructure development. Regulators must establish systems for monitoring compliance with licensing requirements. They need mechanisms to verify reserve adequacy and redemption capability for licensed stablecoins. The tax reporting framework requires secure data transmission systems between virtual asset service providers and tax authorities. These systems must protect sensitive financial information while ensuring accurate reporting. Authorities will collaborate with technology providers and industry experts to develop appropriate technical standards. The government may establish sandbox environments for testing regulatory technologies before full implementation. International cooperation will be essential for developing interoperable systems across jurisdictions. Hong Kong‚Äôs approach will likely influence technical standards development in other Asian financial centers considering similar regulations. Industry Response and Adaptation Virtual asset industry participants have generally welcomed Hong Kong‚Äôs regulatory clarity while noting implementation challenges. Stablecoin issuers appreciate the certainty provided by clear licensing requirements. However, they must invest significantly in compliance systems and processes. Custodians face similar adaptation requirements under the new custody regulations. Smaller market participants may struggle with compliance costs, potentially leading to industry consolidation. Traditional financial institutions view the regulations as an opportunity to expand into digital asset services. Several major banks have announced plans to develop cryptocurrency custody services in anticipation of the regulatory framework. Asset managers are exploring tokenized investment products using regulated stablecoins. The regulatory developments have stimulated increased hiring of compliance and legal professionals with digital asset expertise in Hong Kong. Conclusion Hong Kong‚Äôs comprehensive stablecoin licensing and crypto tax framework establishes the territory as a forward-thinking regulator in the digital asset space. The phased implementation approach provides necessary adaptation time for market participants while maintaining regulatory rigor. These developments position Hong Kong competitively in the global race to establish clear digital asset regulations. The framework balances innovation facilitation with consumer protection and financial stability. As implementation progresses through 2025 and beyond, Hong Kong‚Äôs regulatory approach will likely influence digital asset policy development across Asia and globally. The territory‚Äôs commitment to international cooperation, particularly regarding tax information exchange, demonstrates its alignment with global standards while maintaining its distinctive regulatory character. FAQs Q1: When will Hong Kong‚Äôs stablecoin licensing regime take effect? The Hong Kong Monetary Authority will implement the stablecoin licensing framework in phases throughout 2025, with legislation submitted to the Legislative Council this year and detailed regulations following approval. Q2: How will the crypto tax framework affect individual cryptocurrency investors? Individual investors will continue under existing tax principles, with the new framework primarily enhancing reporting by virtual asset service providers to tax authorities beginning in 2028. Q3: What types of stablecoins will the licensing regime cover? The regime will cover all stablecoins offered in Hong Kong, including fiat-backed, commodity-backed, and algorithmic stablecoins, with specific requirements for each category based on risk profile. Q4: Will Hong Kong‚Äôs regulations align with international standards? Yes, Hong Kong designed its regulatory approach to align with international standards including the Financial Action Task Force recommendations and OECD Crypto-Asset Reporting Framework. Q5: How will the digital asset custody regulations protect investors? The regulations will require custodians to implement stringent security measures, maintain adequate insurance, segregate client assets, and undergo regular independent audits to protect investor holdings. This post Hong Kong Stablecoin Licensing Unveils Groundbreaking Crypto Tax Framework for 2025 first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: Why Is Crypto Down Today? ‚Äì January 30, 2026
body: The crypto market is down today. It fell 5.8% over the past 24 hours, below $3 trillion, now standing at $2.89 trillion. Significantly, 97 of the top 100 coins saw their prices decrease in this period. The total crypto trading volume stands at $207 billion, notably higher than in the previous days. TLDR: Crypto market cap is down 5.8% on Friday morning (UTC); 97 of the top 100 coins and all top 10 coins have gone down; BTC decreased by 6.5% to $82,389, and ETH fell 7.9% to $2,721; Bitcoin saw a wave of long liquidations, pushing the price down; This dip below $83,500 could lead to a retest of the November low around $80,000; Arthur Hayes linked BTC‚Äôs pullback to a sharp contraction in USD liquidity rather than crypto-specific factors; As BTC matured into an institutional asset, the volatility that once attracted retail participants diminished; ‚ÄòFactors such as the stabilization in long-term holder selling and progress on US market-structure legislation could act as catalysts‚Äô; BTC‚Äôs underperformance compared to gold ‚Äòis a source of frustration for crypto investors‚Äô; Peter Schiff said that people should‚Äôve bought gold or silver instead of BTC; Both US spot BTC and ETH ETFs posted outflows of $817.87 million and $155.61 million, respectively; Crypto market sentiment posted a significant drop, moving toward the extreme fear zone. Crypto Winners & Losers On Friday morning (UTC), all top 10 coins per market capitalisation have seen their prices decrease. Bitcoin (BTC) fell by 6.5%, currently trading at $82,389. Bitcoin (BTC) 24h 7d 30d 1y All time Ethereum (ETH) is down 7.9%, changing hands at $2,721. This is the highest drop in the category. The second-highest fall is 7.7% by Lido Staked Ether (STETH) , currently standing at $2,727. Binance Coin (BNB) is next, with a 6.9%, now trading at $840. The smallest decrease among the top 10 is 1.4% by Tron (TRX) , changing hands at $0.2897. Furthermore, of the top 100 coins per market cap, 97 have posted price decreases today. Of these, five saw double decreases. Mantle (MNT) is at the top with a 11.7% rise to $0.792. It‚Äôs followed by Worldcoin (WLD)‚Äôs and Hyperliquid (HYPE)‚Äôs 10.9% each to the prices of $0.458 and $29.23, respectively. Pump-fun (PUMP) fell the most, with the only double-digit drop of 10% to $0.003001. River (RIVER) is next, having dropped 7.3% to the price of $50.56. On the green side, we find Canton (CC) , Figure Heloc (FIGR_HELOC) , and LEO Token (LEO) . These are up 8.9%, 1.3%, and 0.3% to $0.1754, $1.04, and $9.22, respectively. Meanwhile, former BitMEX chief executive Arthur Hayes argued that Bitcoin‚Äôs recent pullback is connected to a $300 billion contraction in U.S. dollar liquidity rather than crypto-specific factors. ‚Äú$BTC falling not a surprise given the fall in $ liquidity,‚Äù Hayes wrote, linking this decrease to macro forces instead of sentiment shifts within the crypto market itself. Roughly $300bn fall in $ liq over past few weeks driven mostly by $200bn rise in TGA, gov could be raising cash balances to fund spending in case of shutdown. $BTC falling not a surprise given the fall in $ liquidity. pic.twitter.com/ctPjWd8188 ‚Äî Arthur Hayes (@CryptoHayes) January 30, 2026 A Source of Frustration for Crypto Investors Kraken‚Äôs Global Economist Thomas Perfumo commented that global liquidity remains constrained, and this has capped crypto performance. Therefore, BTC‚Äôs underperformance compared to precious metals, gold especially, ‚Äúis a source of frustration for crypto investors.‚Äù The macro backdrop seems supportive, with falling interest rates and rising geopolitical uncertainty. This should, investors expect, be beneficial to crypto as a hedge against currency debasement and political instability. ‚ÄúYet despite rate cuts, global liquidity, the factor with the greatest influence on crypto market performance remains tight, underscoring that interest rates are only one component of overall liquidity conditions. By contrast, gold historically benefits from a weakening U.S. dollar.‚Äù Another notable thing is a cultural shift we‚Äôre currently seeing. ‚ÄúAs Bitcoin has matured into an institutional asset, the volatility that once attracted retail participants has diminished,‚Äù Perfumo writes. However, he warns that ‚Äúthis transition is not permanent.‚Äù Rather, its impact on BTC‚Äôs narrative ‚Äúappears to be a matter of patience.‚Äù Perfumo concludes: ‚ÄúFor now, gold is absorbing flows from more risk-sensitive investors, but any meaningful re-rotation of capital could quickly force a reassessment of relative performance, a setup reinforced by the prevailing cynicism of crypto-native investors. Factors such as the stabilization in long-term holder selling and progress on U.S. market-structure legislation could act as catalysts for that shift in flows.‚Äù Moreover, VP at Kraken Matt Howells-Barby added that Bitcoin has felt the impact of the recent AI-related worries. Big Tech is investing in AI heavily, but no corresponding earnings justify this spending. Investors have paused to reassess their risk appetite, he says. Bitcoin saw a wave of long liquidations, pushing the price down. A dip below the $83,500 level could lead to a retest of the November low around $80,000. Levels & Events to Watch Next At the time of writing on Friday morning, BTC was changing hands at $82,389. In the first part of the day, BTC traded sideways at the 87,900 level. However, it plunged to $83,400 and then to the intraday low of $81,314. Over the past week, BTC is down 7.7%, trading in the $82,005-$90,475 range. Moreover, it decreased by 6.8% in a month. Now that it dipped to the $81,300 level, BTC could proceed to fall below the $80,000 mark to $79,800. This would further take it towards $75,000. Bitcoin Price Chart. Source: TradingView At the same time, Ethereum was trading at $2,721. While initially trading at the $2,900 level, ETH quickly dropped, first to $2,800, and then to the day‚Äôs low of $2,705. It is also down 7.2% in a week, moving between $2,715 and $3,034. Additionally, in the past 30 days, ETH fell by 8.1%. ETH has seen a significant drop over the past day. Should it stay red, it will revisit the $2,630, $2,550, and $2,490 levels. Ethereum (ETH) 24h 7d 30d 1y All time Meanwhile, the crypto market sentiment recorded a significant decrease since this time a day ago, as the market pulled back. The crypto fear and greed index currently stands at 28 , compared to 38 recorded yesterday. This drop moved the metric deep within the fear territory, towards extreme fear. The decrease in sentiment is not surprising given the overall market fall. Participants are highly cautious and increasingly worried in the face of unfavourable economic and geopolitical signals seen over the past week. ETFs Go Deep Red The US BTC spot exchange-traded funds (ETFs) closed the Thursday session with significant negative flows. They recorded $817.87 million in outflows on 29 January. This is the largest minus since 20 November 2025. The total net inflow decreased to $55.52 billion. Of the twelve ETFs, eight have gone red, and none are green. BlackRock is at the top, with $317.81 million in outflows. Fidelity and Grayscale follow with negative flows of $168.05 million and $156.56 million, respectively. The US ETH ETFs also posted inflows during the Thursday session, letting go of $155.61 million . The total net inflow stands at $12.23 billion. Of the nine ETH ETFs, five saw outflows. Fidelity recorded the highest negative flows on this list of $59.19 million. BlackRock is next with $54.88 million in outflows. Meanwhile, Bitcoin‚Äôs value against gold fell near 2017 levels , economist Peter Schiff noted. ‚ÄúMost people who now own Bitcoin would have been better off buying gold or silver instead,‚Äù he wrote. Bitcoin is now worth just 15.5 ounces of gold, down 57% from its 2021 high and just 10% above its 2017 high. Despite all the hype and support from Wall Street and the Trump administration, most people who now own Bitcoin would have been better off buying gold or silver instead. ‚Äî Peter Schiff (@PeterSchiff) January 29, 2026 Quick FAQ Did crypto move with stocks today? The crypto market saw a notable decrease over the past 24 hours. Meanwhile, the US stock market closed the Thursday session with a somewhat mixed picture, but mostly down. By the closing time on 29 January, the S&P 500 was down 0.13%, the Nasdaq-100 decreased by 0.53%, and the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose by 0.11%. This came as the investors were digesting US earning reports. Microsoft and software companies‚Äô shares also pushed the TradFi market lower. Is this drop sustainable? For now, yes. The market could continue dropping in the short term, pulled down by various economic and geopolitical factors. That said, it‚Äôs typical for the crypto market to recover swiftly, even if briefly. Though there are no major reasons to worry at the moment, analysts are observing if we‚Äôve entered a bear market. You may also like: (LIVE) Crypto News Today: Latest Updates for January 30, 2026 The crypto market is down today. It fell 5.8% over the past 24 hours, below $3 trillion, now standing at $2.89 trillion. Significantly, 97 of the top 100 coins saw their prices decrease in this period. The total crypto trading volume stands at $207 billion, notably higher than in the previous days.Crypto Winners & LosersOn Friday morning (UTC), all top 10 coins per market capitalisation have seen their prices decrease.Bitcoin (BTC) fell by 6.5%, currently trading at... title: As Dogecoin (DOGE) Fades From the Spotlight, Here‚Äôs the Token Being Touted as the Next Big Crypto
body: As Dogecoin (DOGE) fades from the spotlight and price consolidates, analysts are looking for the next big crypto investment. MUTM: Positioned for Strong Growth The presale of Mutuum Finance offers a unique investment opportunity for investors to realize their maximum gains. In Phase 7, the price of the MUTM token is set at $0.04, which will increase to $0.045 in Phase 8. This means that, for example, an investment of $3,000 at a price of $0.04 will result in the purchase of 75,000 MUTM tokens. This investment will be worth $3,375 when the price rises to $0.045, thus providing an instant gain of $375, even before the official launch of the token. The official token launch will be $0.06, leading to even bigger returns. However, the real excitement will begin after the official launch, with up to 20x gains expected. The Mutuum Finance Protocol is now live on the Sepolia testnet, allowing users to access various features such as lending, borrowing, and staking. The platform has features, including liquidity pools, mtTokens, debt tokens, and an automated liquidator bot. At the moment, the platform is supporting USDT, ETH, LINK, and WBTC. With the ability to generate yields, crypto holders can benefit from the use of the Mutuum Finance Protocol, making it a prime candidate for the next big crypto in DeFi. Unlock Liquidity Without Selling Assets One of the biggest issues that crypto investors face is the ability to access cash without having to sell off their investments and thus forgoing the opportunity to gain from future price appreciation. However, the borrowing mechanism proposed by the MUTM platform addresses this issue. For instance, if an investor puts in 4 ETH, valued at approximately $12,000, the user can then borrow $9,600 in the form of USDT at an 80% LTV ratio. The ETH remains exposed to future price gains in the market while they access instant cash to attend to their pressing needs. MUTM‚Äôs Reserve Factor: Safety and Stability in Action The reserve factor is one of the most important factors in the Mutuum Finance (MUTM) protocol, as it helps ensure the long-term stability of the platform, providing safety and stability for both lenders and borrowers. The reserve factor can be thought of as an automatic risk management tool, where a small percentage of the interest paid by borrowers goes into the reserve pool. This reserve pool is essential in maintaining protocol solvency. To understand this concept, let‚Äôs take an example where a user borrows a stable asset. Suppose that the user borrows 10,000 USDC with an APY of 8%. If the USDC asset has a reserve factor of 10%, then the lender could receive 7.2% of the APY, and the remaining 0.8% goes into the reserve pool. However, in the case where the asset is not stable, the reserve factor must be higher. For example, let‚Äôs say that the user borrows an asset with an APY of 12% and a reserve factor of 25%. In this case, the lender receives 9% of the APY, and the remaining 3% goes into the reserve pool. As the popularity of Dogecoin fades, Mutuum Finance (MUTM) is becoming the next big crypto. title: Bybit ZAMA Listing: Strategic Expansion Brings New Trading Opportunities to Global Markets
body: BitcoinWorld Bybit ZAMA Listing: Strategic Expansion Brings New Trading Opportunities to Global Markets Major cryptocurrency exchange Bybit announced today its decision to list ZAMA for spot trading, marking a significant expansion of its digital asset offerings and providing traders with access to another emerging cryptocurrency. This strategic move follows Bybit‚Äôs established pattern of carefully selecting promising assets that demonstrate both technological innovation and market potential. The listing represents a calculated step in the exchange‚Äôs ongoing mission to diversify its trading pairs while maintaining rigorous security standards. Bybit ZAMA Listing Details and Trading Specifications Bybit confirmed the ZAMA listing through official channels on November 15, 2024, with trading scheduled to commence within the coming week. The exchange will initially support ZAMA trading pairs against major stablecoins including USDT and USDC. Furthermore, Bybit plans to implement its standard tiered fee structure for ZAMA transactions, which typically offers reduced rates for high-volume traders. This approach aligns with the exchange‚Äôs commitment to competitive pricing across all supported assets. The listing process follows Bybit‚Äôs comprehensive evaluation framework that assesses multiple factors before adding any new cryptocurrency. Exchange representatives emphasized their due diligence process, which includes technical security audits, liquidity considerations, and regulatory compliance reviews. Consequently, traders can expect the same robust infrastructure that supports Bybit‚Äôs existing 800+ trading pairs to now extend to ZAMA transactions. ZAMA Token Fundamentals and Market Context ZAMA operates as a privacy-focused cryptocurrency that implements advanced cryptographic techniques to enhance transaction confidentiality. The project‚Äôs development team includes researchers from leading academic institutions who specialize in zero-knowledge proof technology. Since its mainnet launch in early 2023, ZAMA has gradually gained recognition within the privacy coin segment, though it remains smaller than established alternatives like Monero and Zcash. Market analysts note that ZAMA‚Äôs trading volume has increased approximately 47% over the past quarter across decentralized exchanges. This growth trajectory likely contributed to Bybit‚Äôs decision to list the asset. The token currently maintains a circulating supply of 85 million coins with a maximum supply capped at 210 million, implementing a predictable emission schedule similar to Bitcoin‚Äôs model but with enhanced privacy features. ZAMA Token Metrics and Comparison Metric ZAMA Privacy Coin Average Market Capitalization $420 million $1.2 billion Daily Volume (30-day avg) $18.5 million $65 million Transaction Speed 45 seconds 2.5 minutes Active Addresses 12,500 38,000 Exchange Listing Strategy and Market Impact Bybit‚Äôs listing decision reflects broader trends in cryptocurrency exchange expansion strategies. Industry observers note that exchanges increasingly prioritize assets with unique technological propositions rather than merely following market capitalization rankings. This selective approach helps differentiate platforms in a competitive market while potentially identifying undervalued projects before they achieve mainstream recognition. The immediate market impact of exchange listings typically follows a predictable pattern. Historical data from similar listings shows an average price increase of 15-25% in the first 48 hours following announcement, though this varies significantly based on broader market conditions. Additionally, new listings generally increase an asset‚Äôs trading volume by 300-500% initially as new investor segments gain access. Bybit‚Äôs Growing Exchange Ecosystem Founded in 2018, Bybit has rapidly ascended to become one of the world‚Äôs top cryptocurrency exchanges by trading volume. The platform currently serves over 20 million registered users across more than 160 countries. Bybit‚Äôs expansion strategy emphasizes both geographical reach and product diversification, having recently obtained regulatory approvals in several key markets including the European Union and Dubai. The exchange‚Äôs listing committee employs a multi-stage evaluation process for potential additions: Technical Assessment: Code audit, security review, and blockchain stability analysis Market Evaluation: Trading volume patterns, liquidity depth, and community engagement metrics Compliance Review: Regulatory alignment, legal opinions, and jurisdictional considerations Strategic Fit: Alignment with Bybit‚Äôs product roadmap and user demand indicators This systematic approach has helped Bybit maintain a reputation for listing quality projects while avoiding assets with significant red flags. The exchange‚Äôs previous listings in 2024 have generally performed well, with an average retention rate of 94% among listed assets over the past two years. Privacy Coin Market Dynamics and Regulatory Considerations The privacy coin segment represents approximately 2.3% of the total cryptocurrency market capitalization, having maintained relatively stable proportions despite regulatory pressures. Jurisdictions vary significantly in their approach to privacy-focused cryptocurrencies, with some implementing strict limitations while others adopt more permissive stances. Bybit‚Äôs decision to list ZAMA suggests confidence in navigating these complex regulatory landscapes. Industry experts note that privacy technologies continue evolving to balance confidentiality with compliance requirements. Modern privacy protocols increasingly incorporate optional transparency features that allow users to disclose transaction details to authorized parties when necessary. This technological evolution may explain why major exchanges remain willing to list select privacy-focused assets despite regulatory uncertainties in some markets. Trading Infrastructure and User Experience Enhancements Bybit plans to integrate ZAMA into its full suite of trading tools and interfaces. Users will access ZAMA markets through the exchange‚Äôs web platform, mobile applications, and API connections. The listing includes support for all standard order types including market, limit, and conditional orders. Additionally, Bybit will extend its institutional-grade security measures to ZAMA holdings, including multi-signature wallets and cold storage solutions. The exchange‚Äôs matching engine processes approximately 100,000 transactions per second, ensuring minimal latency for ZAMA traders. This infrastructure has proven particularly valuable during periods of high market volatility when transaction speed becomes critical. Bybit also provides comprehensive charting tools, real-time market data, and risk management features that will now support ZAMA trading pairs. Conclusion Bybit‚Äôs ZAMA listing represents a strategic expansion of the exchange‚Äôs cryptocurrency offerings, providing traders with access to an emerging privacy-focused digital asset. This development follows established patterns of exchange growth through careful asset selection and infrastructure enhancement. The listing will likely increase ZAMA‚Äôs market accessibility while offering Bybit users additional trading opportunities. As cryptocurrency markets continue evolving, such exchange listings remain crucial mechanisms for connecting innovative projects with global investor communities. FAQs Q1: When will ZAMA trading begin on Bybit? Bybit has announced the ZAMA listing but has not yet specified the exact trading commencement time. Typically, new listings become active within 3-7 days following announcement, with exact timing communicated through official channels. Q2: What trading pairs will be available for ZAMA on Bybit? Initially, Bybit will offer ZAMA trading against major stablecoins including USDT and USDC. Additional pairs may be introduced based on trading volume and user demand over time. Q3: How does Bybit select which cryptocurrencies to list? title: Crypto Expert Says The Bitcoin Cycle Is Already Over, Here‚Äôs Why
body: Questions are already surfacing over whether Bitcoin is still in the expansion phase that many market participants assume it is. However, a crypto expert opted for a conservative stance, arguing that when Bitcoin is analyzed through traditional cycle theory and macroeconomic indicators, the primary cycle may already be complete. This crypto expert, Tony Severino, challenged popular bullish claims from ‚Äúsnake oil salesmen‚Äù and instead pointed to economic data and historical patterns that show the Bitcoin cycle has already transitioned into a different phase. PMI And ISM Datan Shows Where Bitcoin Is According to Tony Severino, Bitcoin‚Äôs bullish cycle is already over, and analysts saying otherwise are pushing a fairy tale that may or may not come true. Severino‚Äôs outlook is based on the U.S. ISM Purchasing Managers‚Äô Index, which he views as a reliable macro gauge for cyclical behavior. Related Reading: Global Liquidity Says Bitcoin Is Extremely Undervalued ‚Äì Here‚Äôs The ‚ÄòReal‚Äô Figure The PMI data shown in the chart below highlights a clear pattern of lower highs and lower lows, which is a signal of a weakening manufacturing environment. According to Severino, real cycles are measured from trough to trough, not from speculative projections of future upside. From that perspective, the current PMI structure means that the cycle has already peaked and is now rolling over. At the time of writing, this index is sitting around 47.9. Severino warned that a sustained move below the 46 level would change the PMI from a local pullback into a more pronounced intermediate downtrend. A drop beneath 41.6 would carry even more serious implications, as that level would fall below the COVID-era low. Such a move would leave only extreme historical comparisons, including conditions last seen during the 2007-2009 Great Financial Crisis or the stagflation period of the 1970s and early 1980s. Therefore, this macro backdrop directly challenges the idea that Bitcoin is on the verge of a guaranteed new bullish phase. Severino also took direct aim at popular Bitcoin valuation models that compare BTC to gold or rely on long-term projections detached from economic reality. The current reality is that Bitcoin is lagging behind gold and silver, which are attracting consistent inflows in contrast to Bitcoin‚Äôs show of fatigue around $80,000. Bullish Conviction To Bearish Targets Severino‚Äôs current stance is notable because it is a significant difference from his outlook before the current cycle began, when he was very bullish on Bitcoin. His recent analysis, shown in the chart below, shows Bitcoin breaking below a moving average on the monthly candlestick timeframe. This is notable because similar breakdowns in previous years were followed by drawdowns averaging around 50%. Related Reading: Analyst Reveals How Far Bitcoin Price Will Crash If The Uptrend Doesn‚Äôt Continue The chart highlights multiple instances where Bitcoin suffered declines of 40% to over 60% after losing this type of technical support. Based on that historical behavior, Severino has floated a downside target of at least $45,000 before another bullish reversal. Featured image from Getty Images, chart from Tradingview.com

title: Nubank OCC Approval: A Transformative Leap for Crypto Custody and U.S. Digital Banking
body: BitcoinWorld Nubank OCC Approval: A Transformative Leap for Crypto Custody and U.S. Digital Banking In a landmark decision that could reshape the American digital banking landscape, Nubank has secured conditional approval from the U.S. Office of the Comptroller of the Currency to establish a federal branch. This pivotal Nubank OCC approval, reported by CoinDesk in May 2025, clears a critical regulatory path for the Latin American fintech giant to offer cryptocurrency custody services and traditional banking products within the United States. The move signals a significant shift in federal receptiveness to integrated digital asset banking. Decoding the Nubank OCC Approval and Its Immediate Implications The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency granted Nubank a conditional license for a U.S. branch. This approval represents a crucial regulatory milestone. Consequently, the bank must now satisfy specific operational conditions before receiving its final charter. Upon finalization, Nubank will operate under a federal framework. This framework allows it to offer a unified suite of financial services across state lines. These services will strategically include: Digital Asset Custody: Secure storage and management services for cryptocurrencies. Deposit Accounts: Federal insurance-backed checking and savings accounts. Credit Products: Including credit cards and personal lending options. Integrated Financial Platform: A single app combining traditional and digital asset banking. This conditional Nubank OCC approval follows years of strategic preparation. The bank had already identified key American innovation hubs for its expansion. These hubs include Miami, the San Francisco Bay Area, Northern Virginia, and North Carolina‚Äôs Research Triangle. Each location targets distinct tech and financial talent pools. The Strategic Blueprint Behind Nubank‚Äôs U.S. Expansion Nubank‚Äôs journey to this point demonstrates calculated, long-term planning. Founded in Brazil in 2013, the company revolutionized Latin American finance by challenging incumbent banks with fee-free digital products. Its foray into cryptocurrency began in 2022 through a partnership with Paxos. This allowed Brazilian users to buy, sell, and hold Bitcoin and Ethereum directly within the Nubank app. The success of this integration, attracting millions of users, provided a proven model. It proved consumer demand for seamless crypto banking. The U.S. expansion logically extends this model into a larger, yet more complex, regulatory environment. Analysts view the conditional approval as a testament to Nubank‚Äôs robust compliance infrastructure. The OCC, a bureau of the U.S. Treasury, rigorously assesses financial stability, anti-money laundering protocols, and consumer protection measures. Expert Analysis: A Watershed Moment for Regulatory Integration Financial technology experts highlight the broader significance of this decision. ‚ÄúThe conditional Nubank OCC approval is not just about one company,‚Äù notes a fintech regulatory analyst cited in industry reports. ‚ÄúIt represents a tangible step toward a mature regulatory framework for banks that wish to custody digital assets. The OCC is effectively creating a playbook that others will follow.‚Äù This move aligns with a gradual but discernible trend in U.S. financial regulation. Other institutions have pursued similar paths with varying success. The table below contextualizes Nubank‚Äôs milestone against other recent digital asset banking initiatives: Institution Regulatory Milestone Year Key Service Anchorage Digital First OCC National Trust Charter for a Crypto Bank 2021 Digital Asset Custody & Settlement Kraken Bank Wyoming SPDI Bank Charter 2020 Deposit-taking for Crypto Clients Protego Trust Bank Conditional OCC Trust Charter (Not Finalized) 2021 Digital Asset Custody Nubank Conditional OCC Approval for Federal Branch 2025 Integrated Retail Banking & Crypto Custody As shown, Nubank‚Äôs model is distinct. It focuses on serving the general retail consumer, not solely crypto-native clients. This mainstream approach could accelerate public adoption of digital asset services. Potential Market Impact and Competitive Landscape The entry of a well-capitalized, user-experience-focused player like Nubank could disrupt the U.S. neobank sector. Established American digital banks currently offer limited, if any, direct crypto custody. Typically, they rely on third-party integrations. Nubank‚Äôs integrated model provides a seamless alternative. Furthermore, its massive existing user base in Latin America includes a diaspora in the U.S., offering a built-in launch audience. However, the bank will face significant challenges. It must build brand recognition against established U.S. fintechs and traditional banks now exploring digital assets. Additionally, the final OCC conditions will dictate operational scope and capital requirements. Market observers will closely watch the rollout in its initial hub cities. Success in these test markets will likely determine the speed of a national rollout. The Road to Final Approval: What Comes Next? The term ‚Äòconditional approval‚Äô is a key procedural step. It means Nubank has met the OCC‚Äôs preliminary requirements. Now, the bank enters a pre-opening period. During this phase, it must demonstrate it can meet all ongoing safety and soundness standards. The OCC will monitor the bank‚Äôs preparations for its launch. Key focus areas include IT cybersecurity, liquidity management, and full compliance with the Bank Secrecy Act. This process typically takes several months. There is no guaranteed outcome, but conditional approvals often lead to final charters if the institution fulfills all stipulations. The OCC‚Äôs public release emphasized its commitment to ensuring a safe and sound banking system. It also highlighted the importance of responsible innovation in the federal banking system. Conclusion The conditional Nubank OCC approval marks a transformative moment for both the digital bank and the broader financial ecosystem. It paves the way for a novel, integrated offering of cryptocurrency custody and traditional banking under a federal umbrella. This decision validates a growing convergence between conventional finance and digital assets. It also sets a new competitive benchmark for user experience in banking. As Nubank moves to fulfill its final conditions, the industry watches closely. Its success could herald a new chapter of mainstream, federally-regulated crypto banking services in the United States. FAQs Q1: What does conditional OCC approval mean for Nubank? Conditional approval means the OCC has granted preliminary authorization for Nubank to establish a federal branch. However, the bank must now meet specific operational and compliance conditions over a pre-opening period before receiving its final, unrestricted charter to operate. Q2: What services can Nubank offer in the U.S. after final approval? Upon final approval, Nubank‚Äôs U.S. branch can offer digital asset custody services, federally-insured deposit accounts, credit cards, and lending products. It aims to provide an integrated platform combining traditional and crypto banking. Q3: How is Nubank‚Äôs crypto custody different from a regular crypto exchange? As part of a federally-regulated bank, Nubank‚Äôs custody service would operate under strict OCC safety, soundness, and consumer protection rules. This differs from state-licensed or unregulated exchanges, potentially offering greater insurance and regulatory safeguards for customer assets. Q4: Where in the U.S. will Nubank operate initially? Nubank has previously identified plans for hubs in Miami, the San Francisco Bay Area, Northern Virginia, and North Carolina‚Äôs Research Triangle. These locations will likely serve as its initial operational and talent centers for the U.S. rollout. Q5: Why is the OCC‚Äôs role important in this context? The OCC is a federal bureau that charters, regulates, and supervises all national banks. Its approval allows Nubank to operate across state lines under a single federal standard, which is more efficient than seeking licenses from 50 separate state regulators. This post Nubank OCC Approval: A Transformative Leap for Crypto Custody and U.S. Digital Banking first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: Russian authorities confiscate assets in 5-billion-ruble crypto bribery probe
body: A Russian court has ordered the seizure of the property of a former employee of the interior ministry in Moscow, prosecuted for accepting bribes in cryptocurrency worth billions of rubles. The development in the high-profile case comes as Russian lawmakers prepare to legalize the state confiscation of digital assets as part of criminal proceedings this year. Former police official loses his property over crypto-funded corruption The Zyuzinsky District Court in the Russian capital has approved the prosecutors‚Äô claim over the property of a corrupt official from the Ministry of Internal Affairs (MVD). Identified as Georgy Satyukov, the department‚Äôs former employee has been convicted for accepting crypto bribes for a record 5 billion rubles (over $66 million at current exchange rates). The man‚Äôs assets will be seized ‚Äúfor the benefit of the state,‚Äù a participant in the proceedings told RIA Novosti, which quoted the source as stating: ‚ÄúThe court fully upheld the request of the Prosecutor General‚Äôs Office to seize Satyukov‚Äôs property.‚Äù The trial was held behind closed doors, the news agency noted in a report on Thursday. In April 2024, the Basmanny District Court of Moscow sentenced Satyukov in absentia. The ex-specialist in combating financial fraud had fled abroad after the launch of the investigation against him over the massive bribe, the largest in the MVD‚Äôs recent history. He is believed to have been receiving the cryptocurrency in exchange for providing protection to people involved in various financial schemes. In December of that year, the head of Russia‚Äôs Investigative Committee, Alexander Bastrykin, revealed his colleagues had seized over 2 billion rubles as part of the same probe. The whereabouts of one of Satyukov‚Äôs subordinates who is also implicated, Dmitry Sokolov, are unknown, too. Both have been placed on an international wanted listed. Russia to regulate all crypto transactions including state seizure of digital assets Russian authorities are gearing up to comprehensively regulate all transactions with cryptocurrencies, including investment and trading, by the summer of 2026. According to the latest regulatory concept proposed by the Bank of Russia in late December, Bitcoin and the like will be treated as ‚Äúmonetary assets.‚Äù Under current Russian legislation, digital currency has been partially recognized as property, at least in some legal acts. A bill granting it the same status under the country‚Äôs Criminal Law and Criminal Procedure Law was recently approved for final adoption by the legislative committee of the State Duma, the lower house of Russian parliament. The draft law introduces effective mechanisms for the seizure of coins by law enforcement agencies and their subsequent confiscation for the state or to secure civil claims. Earlier in January, Russia‚Äôs Constitutional Court upheld the property rights of cryptocurrency owners, including the right to judicial protection. There have been a number of precedents already in the Russian judicial practice, when crypto holdings have been treated like property. Last week, media reports revealed that the office of Russia‚Äôs Federal Bailiff Service in the Krasnodar Krai region has seized the digital assets of a local resident to settle his child support debt.
